{{champion:267}} Feels like no matter what you ban (as bot three have ban privileges) something gets through that is just exhausting to deal with bc it's broken or OP or whatever else.  It triggers me now when the ENEMY team uses stupid bans because that means there are even -more- open broken  champs for them to pick.

There are no 'stupid bans'.

Bans ONLY matter... if you know BEFORE the Ban/Pick Phase the Strengths and Weaknesses of the Enemy Team.

So in Competition Play against Teams that actually have a history you can research of Comps, of Item Builds, of Synergies, of Weaknesses to Comps... yes, Bans matter.  That team builds around a "Protect the Kog'Maw" Comp and is somehow weak to Split Pushers?  Ban Kog'Maw and incorporate a Split Pusher into your Comp and you're almost to the W!

But those 5 people we don't even have user names for yet... we have ZERO information to go on.

So... then ban "OP Champs" is an idea.  Cool, that's a theory.  But what if the Enemy Teams sucks at those Champions?  But you let through Ashe, who proceeds to go 30-0-10 on you because they happen to be insanely good at Ashe, who no one bans.

In other words, you have zero information to make an Informed Ban in the first place.

The idea is to ban champions that are experience ruining atm. Champs that make the overall match not fun just because they were picked, either through the anxious feeling because you can't prevent your teammates from giving them a lead or through limiting the amount of playable champs due to a need to hard counter them.

I understand that, and agree.

But there is really no Bad Ban.  So some one banned Teemo... just your luck, Enemy has a guy that's 80% on Teemo.  They ban Darius... no one on your team even plays Darius.

There really is no rhyme or reason to it outside of Team Competition.

I do agree to try to nuke out any of the annoying Champions, but define 'annoying'.  Something super mechanical like Zed?  Or something really easy (to play, not master) like Yi?  Teemo is annoying... ban him?  Couldn't Braum be called annoying with his Shield blocking all the incoming Ults?  Karthus is annoying... but worth banning?

What Champs are universally 'unfun'?  Your team mates might not be able to stop Janna from getting a lead... you don't know that until you get in game, being the point.
or you can strategize instead of ________ your head off

Increasing bans to matter more in countering overpowered champions or strategies in team play would be pretty cool, but it'd also be pretty lame for potentially removing interesting champions away from one or two players
If only Riot could make perfect champions/items with zero flaws they wouldn't have to change anything- why can't Riot just be perfect so they don't have to change anything?
